description: A short lesson to help you apply Remote Work Conflict Patterns.

hook.text: Remote teams have 2.5 times more misunderstandings than in-person teams â€” and they notice them later.

buildup.text: Without body language, tone is misread in emails and messages constantly.

discovery.text: A neutral message like 'Fine.' reads as passive-aggressive in text â€” even when it isn't.

twist.text: Remote conflicts escalate faster because there's no hallway conversation to clear things up casually.

climax.text: The fix: default to video for any tense conversation. Never resolve conflict over text.

punchline.text: If it could be misread, it will be. Pick up the camera.

quiz.question: Why do remote teams experience more misunderstandings?
options: Text communication lacks body language and tone cues
Remote work attracts more argumentative people
